name: 狄雅南
objective: Advanced Mass Transfer (MT) will be divided into theory of diffusion, interphase mass transfer theory, mass transfer in turbulent flow, mass transfer with chemical reaction, simultaneous mass and heat transfer, multicomponent diffusion.
schedule:
1st week: Fick's law of binary diffusion (Ch. 17)
2nd week: Temperature and pressure dependence diffusivities
3rd week: Theory of diffusion in gases, liquids, colloidal, polymer
4th week: Problem exercises
5th week: Shell mass balances and boundary conditions (Ch. 18)
6th week: Diffusion with homogeneous and  heterogeneous chemical reaction 
7th week: Diffusion into falling liquids 
8th week: Diffusion and chemical reaction inside a porous catalyst
9th week: Midterm exam 
10th week: The equations of change for multicomponent systems (Ch. 19) 
11th week: Interface transport in nonisothermal mixtures (Ch. 22)
12th week: Mass transfer and chemical reactions
13th week: Combined heat and mass transfer by free convection 
14th week: Effects of interfacial forces on heat and mass transfer
15th week: Transfer coefficients at high net mass transfer rates
16th week: Review and problems exercise
17th week: Group presentation
18th week: Group presentation
scorePolicy:
Mid-term　　        　　　　                                45 %
Final Exam 　　　　　　　　                        35 %
Homework, Classroom participants (Q&A)　　20 %
materials: Bird, R.B., Stewart, W.E., Lightfoot, E.N., Transport Phenomena, 2nd Ed., John Wileyy & Sons, New York (2007).
remarks: Students can ask any time through the i-Plus system or offline discussions at Chemical Engineering-411. This course will use English.
